publications.name: A Pathway Out of Extreme Poverty: A Case Study of the Unconditional Cash Transfer Scheme to Extremely Poor Women in Musanze, Rwanda

authors.headline: Works at Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre

company.name: Graduate School of Social Sciences, University of Amsterdam

profile_positions.company: Graduate School of Social Sciences, University of Amsterdam
profile_positions.description:
This research is in partnership with 100 Weeks, a Dutch organization focusing on poverty reduction in Africa. I focused on the sustainable impact of development aid in the form of cash transfers. My research is about targeting and empowering women in extreme poverty and social exclusion through the Unconditional Cash Transfer (UCT) scheme. I then evaluated UCT using my newly combined sustainable livelihood (SL) and dynamic poverty (DP) approach toward inclusive development. I also analyzed the theory of change of the program, its partnership model, and its selection process. Qualitative and quantitative methods were used in this field work to measure the following variables:
- Livelihoods
- Financial aspects
- Food security
- Natural (environmental)
- Psychological 
- Social/relational 
- Health
- Education of children

Themes: Sustainable Development, Inclusive Development, Poverty Reduction, Development Intervention, Women Empowerment, Unconditional Cash Transfer, Rwanda
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher

company.name: Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment
profile_positions.description:
At the Embassy of New Zealand, I served as a subject matter expert on migrant workers’ labor conditions, rights, and occupational safety and health standards, and including family reunification addressing concerns on custody of children. I handled complex and sensitive cases using expertise in policy analysis, risk and compliance management, and investigations (customer due diligence, verifications, quality checks, standard operating procedures, and service standards) related to immigration, human mobility, and cross-border management issues. Moreover, I managed the capacity development of staff, requiring various coaching, mentoring, and training.

Key achievements:
	Decided more than 4,000 visa applications (including assessing contracts + research) of people wanting to migrate in New Zealand  through efficient analysis and assessment of information against relevant immigration instructions/policies.
	Spearheaded projects resulting in improved processes, events, and business operations such as the Comprehensive Work Guidelines 2018 and Student Guidelines 2019
	Rated as “Outstanding Performer” and received Service Champion award


Personal Specifications:
•	Excellent knowledge of current immigration law, policy, procedures & guidelines
•	Ability to work effectively without direct supervision
•	Ability to manage and organize fluctuating workloads in a fast-paced & ever-changing environment
•	A positive attitude working with people of different cultures, gender & abilities
•	Consistent decision-making skills
•	Effective written & oral communication
profile_positions.title: Senior Immigration Officer

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment
profile_positions.description:
I delivered technical expertise, analysis, and input into operational policy development and other office-led projects and reviews related to immigration, human mobility, and cross-border management issues. I conducted various training and coaching regarding policy changes, workflow, compliance, contracts, and time management, privacy, and market-related risks. Moreover, I completed quality checks, drafted communication, and dealt with internal and external networks. I participated during stakeholder meetings to present policy analysis, changes, and solutions.

Key achievements:
	I managed the capacity development of 24 Immigration Officers and 4 Support Officers resulting in improved performance, productivity targets, and higher quality decisions and outputs. 
	Rated as “Outstanding Performer” and received  3 star of the month awards
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment
profile_positions.description:
I was the team leader of the work team and managed all market-related risks. I researched the international labor supply chain data on the exploitation of the vulnerable Filipino migrant workers.

Key Achievements:
	Efficiently systematized office templates resulting in calibrated assessments and processes          
	Presented during the “International Stakeholder Engagement Presentation” on immigration laws and policies in the years 2015 and 2016
	Sent to Bangkok, Thailand for a seconded role as a high performing officer
	Rated as “Outstanding Performer”, received 2 star of the month and 2 Outstanding Service awards
profile_positions.title: Immigration Officer

profile_positions.location: Embassy of New Zealand Manila, Philippines
profile_positions.company: Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment
profile_positions.description:
I proactively supported administrative work across the branch including file management for the quality assurance programme, facilitating the designations process, warrant card processing, staff travel and other general branch administration. I also contributed to the operations of the Quality and Assurance team and the wider Service Design and Performance branch 
- Checking and/or distributing information for internal and external stakeholders
- Providing file management support for physical/electronic files
- Liaising with customers, third parties, and stakeholders to obtain
further information or answer queries
-Completing data entry
profile_positions.title: Support Officer

company.name: Embassy of the Republic of South Korea

profile_positions.company: Embassy of the Republic of South Korea
profile_positions.description:
I conducted summary reports, research, and news analysis on current events concerning the political and security landscape of the Philippines. I also scheduled and organized official functions and meetings as well as coordinating/managing scholarship and humanitarian programs. 

Key achievements:
	Annually managed and financially distributed three student scholarship programs for underprivileged grandchildren of war veterans with a total yearly project fund amounting to $40,000 reaching 150 to 200 students.
	Led the humanitarian response to the victim-survivors of Typhoon Haiyan 2013 with more than 25 million dollars rehabilitation aid including the deployment emergency relief team
       Successfully facilitated events including the Republic of Korea National Day, Annual Celebration of the Filipino War Veterans, Korea Armed Forces Day, and the conference entitled “Korea as a partner of Association of Southeast Asian Nation (ASEAN): Furthering cooperation for enhanced friendship and common prosperity through Official Development Assistance.”
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant (researcher/coordinator)

company.name: Embassy of the Republic of South Korea

profile_positions.company: Embassy of the Republic of South Korea
profile_positions.description: I demonstrated the ability to cover different areas of operations namely administration, travel, immigration, procurement, human resources, and an understanding of the impact of operations on finances. I conducted summary reports, research, and news analysis on current events designated by the political and economic counselors, and minister. I drafted diplomatic correspondence and official letters for government and international organizations. I arranged meetings and coordinated with the Department of Foreign Affairs, local government units, and international institutions.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant (researcher/coordinator)

profile_positions.description:
Intern officer at the Office of Asia and the Pacific Affairs of the Department of Foreign Affairs, Philippines

	Accountable for gathering research and administrative tasks delegated by the secretaries and directors for division III B South East Asia II (Cambodia, Laos, Thailand, Timor-Leste) and division V Pacific (Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, Palau, Fili, Samoa, Tonga, Federated States of Micronesia, Republic of Marshall Island, Solomon Island, Kiribati, New Caledonia, Tuvalu, Vanuatu, Nauru and Pacific Island Forum).
profile_positions.title: Internship

profile_positions.description:
Philippine Delegate for the Asia Pacific Youth Assembly hosted by London School of Public Relations.

Topic: Environmental conservation, tackling climate change.
profile_positions.title: Philippine Representative

volunteer_experiences.description: I am assisting the monitoring and evaluation, and communication team in analyzing their data, questions, and survey guidelines. I also completed reviewing and summarizing 6 research theses (quantitative and qualitative) on the impact of the program as a pathway out of extreme poverty.

Managing the partnership team of the Association of Southeast Asian Nation Youth Organization including its overall implementation within the three subgroups.
- social media
- donors
- sponsors/in-kind
- community partner

1. Economic Enhancement
Creating sustainable Economic Enhancement through the skills & creativity of youth in the region.

2. Youth Empowerment
Strengthening social interest, skills, and competency through Entrepreneurship and Education for our future

3. Social Volunteerism
Spreading awareness of Volunteerism to improve understanding among youth and society around us
